content:
The graduation requirements for engineering majors at Texas A&M University are as follows:

1. Complete all core curriculum requirements.
2. Complete all degree requirements for the chosen engineering major.
3. Maintain a minimum cumulative GPA of at least 2.0.
4. Complete a minimum of 128 semester credit hours of coursework.
5. Complete at least 36 upper-level credit hours beyond the core curriculum.
6. Complete a capstone design experience.
7. Pass the Engineering Ethics exam.
8. Complete the Texas A&M University Exit Survey.
9. Satisfy any additional requirements specified by the major department or college.

Please note that these requirements may vary depending on the specific engineering major and any additional certifications, minors, or co-op/internship programs pursued by the student.
